title: STUA logotype wide skinny sans
content:
i’m not sure if this is an actual face, or just lettering for the logo, but i’d love to find out what it is if it’s availalbe somewhere. thanks!

logo is located: [http://www.stua.com/IMAGES/LOGO.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808055847/http:/www.stua.com/IMAGES/LOGO.jpg "http://www.stua.com/IMAGES/LOGO.jpg")

 [‹ "Streets" dirty brush script in "Streets of Rage"](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808055847/http:/typophile.com/node/19373 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "The Other Side of Israel" book cover - Alternate Gothic No. 1 {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808055847/http:/typophile.com/node/19392 "Go to next forum topic")
author: johndiggity

comments.content: Is there more? This is looking like quick and dirty illustrator to me, but I’ve been wrong about this before.
this is all i’ve seen as far as these letters go. it’s not zeppelin either, if you notice the curves of the “S” are significantly different, as well as the axial, not radial cuts.
